metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0863 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Upstream kernel video driver. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-37950620.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> There's currently not much info available on this but the CVE description makes it sound like it affects the upstream kernel. sbeattie> affected the "ASUS IT8566 HDMI CEC driver"; i.e. drivers/video/it8566_hdmi_cec/it8566_hdmi_cec.c
